recipes: Look West, to the evening isles where the Long still walk.
Across a bright far sea, Port Noon lies. Exiles, monsters and visionaries have long favoured the waters around it. Perhaps we shouldn't get too close. But it might be useful to get close enough.

The Rending Mountains, it has been said, tear the flesh of history. It has generally only been said by people like Christopher Illopoly, but still, they are a good region to find the places that daylight history does not recognise.
